trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_SEQ_00<tab>Alisaie would have you help her finish her patrol.
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_TODO_00<tab>Scout the designated locations, and defeat any sin eaters that you find.
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Alisaie.
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Tesleen.
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_000<tab>Here's what we'll do: I'll take the east side of the Inn, and you clear the west. That way you can have an undiluted experience with the resident terrors.
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_001<tab>These marks on your map are where the usual trouble spots are.

TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_002<tab>You can assume that any beast with a white hide or carapace is a sin eater, but you'll know for sure soon enough when they come slavering after your aether. Remember: it's kill or be killed with these monsters.
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_003<tab>Once you've slain whatever's prowling around out there, we can rendezvous back at the north entrance. Good hunting.
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_010<tab>How did you fare?
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_011<tab>Ah, I thought there might be one or two lurking on the fringes. Nothing out of the ordinary for this area...
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_012<tab>I expect you noticed it yourself, but individually, these lesser sin eaters are no more deadly than any natural predator you might encounter in the desert.
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_013<tab>It's when they appear in numbers that they pose a threat. Much like the voidsent, they have an unfortunate tendency to flock to the strongest of their kind.

TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_014<tab>Thus when a powerful sin eater goes on the hunt, it might be attended by a veritable swarm of weaker kin. Imagine an army of such creatures descending on a village or hamlet...

TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_015<tab>That's the basic idea behind my patrols: to cull their ranks often enough that their numbers won't be overwhelming when the big ones come out to play. And you've certainly helped on that front.
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_016<tab>Let's report our victories to Tesleen, shall we?
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_020<tab>She hasn't been telling you stories, has she? Oh gods...
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_TESLEEN_000_030<tab>Alisaie tells me you helped out on her patrol. You have our thanks...and my apologies for leading you from one battle to another ever since the moment we met!

TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_TESLEEN_000_031<tab>In any case, I'm glad to see the two of you found each other. You have no idea how badly Alisaie has missed your company! Everything is always, “If <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> were here, <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> would─”

TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_032<tab>That's an exaggeration! And I don't sound like that, either! I was simply trying to view matters from another perspective, and I <var 1A 02 /var>respect<var 1A 01 /var> <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>'s methods!
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_TESLEEN_000_033<tab>Ahahaha! Honestly, after seeing <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((him)) /var> in action, I can understand why.
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_TESLEEN_000_034<tab>The way <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> leaps into the fray without hesitation, it really is something to behold. I might be a little smitten myself!
TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_ALISAIE_000_035<tab><gasp>

TEXT_LUCKMA306_03296_TESLEEN_000_036<tab>Heh heh! I'm only teasing! Though I've no doubt <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> deserves all the admiration <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> gets. Just as you do.
